items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible on Tuesday evening. Continued rain, with heavy spells, throughout the day has meant that the River Dart is now rising rapidly and there is likely to be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river. 
We expect the river to remain high throughout the evening. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 
Environment Agency staff are monitoring river levels and have we staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Wednesday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible on Tuesday evening. Continued rain, with heavy spells, throughout the day has caused the Rivers Clyst and Culm to rise and there is likely to be flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river. 
We expect the river to remain high throughout the night. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 
Environment Agency staff will continue to monitor river levels. This message will be updated on Wednesday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. We continue to monitor the situation.

This Flood Alert has been removed. 

River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
 
The forecast today, 29/09/2021 is for scattered showers. 

Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

items.description: Sor Brook and The Bloxham Brook and their tributaries

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Sor, Bloxham Brook, Hornton Stream

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.
 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. The forecast today, 29/09/2021 is for scattered showers. 
  
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.
